Lobbyist Name: Meath Women's Refuge and Support Services
Specific Details: Meath Women's Refuge was invited to meet the housing SPC of Meath County Council in relation to domestic violence and housing. At the meeting we sought support for the development of a new refuge in Meath from elected councillors and council officials, including the potential gifting of a site for the new development and support for a CAS application.
DPOs Lobbied: Sinead Burke|Councillor|Meath County Council::Nick Killian|Councillor|Meath County Council::Maria Murphy|Councillor|Meath County Council::Sarah Reilly|Councillor|Meath County Council::Gillian Toole|Councillor|Meath County Council::Barry Lynch|Director of Services or Equivalent|Meath County Council
Subject Matter: Meath Women's Refuge was invited to meet the housing SPC of Meath County Council in relation to domestic violence and housing. At the meeting we sought support for the development of a new refuge in Meath from elected councillors and council officials, including the potential gifting of a site for the new development and support for a CAS application.
Intended Results: The support for potentially gifting of a site for a new women's refuge and support for a CAS application to build new units.
Lobbying Activities: It was agreed that we would work with county council housing officials to support the development and we may come back to meet elected officials if required at a later stage in relation to our proposal.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Sinead Smith, Joint Manager of Meath Women's Refuge and Support Services
